intro: Echium anchusoides, commonly known as the anchusa-like echium, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its flowers are tubular and arranged in spikes, attracting a variety of pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Echium anchusoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
